intro: Crossosoma parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered crossosoma, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and small, pale yellow to white flowers. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in shaded undergrowth. Its leaves are ovate and have a velvety texture, making it a distinctive species within its native habitat.
